intro: Descurainia incana var. viscosa, commonly known as sticky canaryweed, is a flowering plant in the Brassicaceae family. It is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves, which give it a sticky texture. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in racemes, typical of the mustard family. It is native to North America and often found in disturbed soils such as roadsides and fields. Its botanical features make it identifiable and distinguishable from other similar species in its genus.
